inm:Record.inm:Title: Man of Aran : storytelling and music from the Islands [sound recording] / [various performers]
inm:Record.inm:PhysicalDescription: 1 sound cassette (60 min., 00 sec.) : analog, mono
inm:Record.inm:Contents: 'These three rocks in the ocean', self-sufficiency, seaweed, making own land, house, curraghs, no such thing as idleness, tea drinking, donkeys, kindness, contact with mainland, weather, grandmother, knitting stocking on way to Galway, independence, manhood
His father. Porpoise fishing; story of great feat; hard man; men at seaweed; alway at work; purchase of horse and cart; £6 provided family living; carting soil; Dublin landlords; emigration, speech
His mother. Wonderful woman; making clothing; comparison with today; Sunday costume, speech
'The hookers', (sailing boats); curragh races round the island, speech
Drink - the poteen (illicit whisky) made himself; first time he got drunk at the age of eight; children offered adult's share, speech
'Pattern day', (Sports on 29th June); seaweed, fighting in fields, speech
Beliefs and superstitions; story of coming home from a wedding, speech
When you die belief; men lost at sea, speech
The strength of the ocean; 20 widows; feeling of accomplishment; compared to landsmen; brings out the manhood in you, song
Trying to catch a walrus; whiskey and tombstones; marriage methods; spirits of the dead, speech
Early, early in the blooming Spring, song =
